39:09

Exactly!! Well said, EA! I couldn't agree more! this tribalism must stop. We're better than that!

That said, spacex rocks and BO sucks. And I hope the first one wins.

Not for the engineering, or the innovation, or the hard work of the rocket-scientists on both sides. No. Everything that improves things is a betterment for humanity at large and spaceflight specifically.

But... It's because Bezos is a modern, 21st slave-trader. He does it with amazon, and he'll do it with BO. Musk has his drawbacks too, but at least he's a visionary, with, I believe, a true grain of interest in advancing our human civilization, and getting us off this planet and turning us into a multi-planetary species - not for his own greed, but because he really thinks it's something that humans need to do.

Bezos is just old business covered in a shiny new jacket, but the bottomline remains money, profit and the control of space, not the advancement of people on itself. And he's shown to have little compassion with his own employees, thus one should fear him being in charge in the solar system.

EA, I sympathize with your plea, and I understand where you're coming from - I even agree with it, in principle. But you seem to be oblivious to the fact we're not cheering for one against the other because of engineering prowess, or on technological grounds, or due to some silly flamewar-induced cravings (well, not all of us, at least), or because we begrudge one company compared to another on itself... but simply because the de facto leaders of those companies have very different views on the world, on space, and how to use their prowess. And in that comparison, it's abundantly clear one can't expect much good, from a humanitarian viewpoint, from the likes of Bezos.

If both would have the same grand visions for humanity in a way that was as compelling, I would root for both equally, for sure. But that's simply not the case here. Now, we can still cheer the engineering marvels both create, mayhaps, but we can not endorse both companies the same way, because both have very different views about the conquest of space, and how to treat humans in that future. A modern slavetrader should not be cheered on, nor his company being endorsed.

It's time to accept and embrace the private companies trying to get humans into space and making us multi-planetary species. It's just like the airplane business: There are many different brands of planes that take people places, but no one cares what brand of plane they ride on, they just ride on them and get to their destination! It should be the same for space flight! We are witnessing space flight history, having the advancements of private sectors to get into space so we aren't eating away at the government's money. Need to stop the tribalism between private space flight investors NOW!
